definition: dead weight/weight capacity of a vehicle
to carry/to convey/to load/to hold/to fill up/and/also/as well as/simultaneously
to record in writing/to carry (i.e. publish in a newspaper etc)/Taiwan pr. [zai4]/year
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: What's the carrying capacity of this vessel? Please fill out clearly.
sentences.chinese: 這艘船的載重量多大，請填寫清楚。

sentences.english: This batch of goods exceed the loading capacity of the truck. We'd better transport them seperately.
sentences.chinese: 這批貨超過了車的載重量，還是分兩批運吧。

sentences.english: The low weight increases the load capacity.
sentences.chinese: 因爲重量輕，所以增加了載重量。

sentences.english: The maximum load of the lorry is one ton.
sentences.chinese: 這卡車的最大載重量是一噸。

sentences.english: every ounce of weight requires tons of material below.
sentences.chinese: 每一盎司的載重量都需要地面上成噸的材料支援。
